greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of iterations of A234742 needed when starting from A091209(n) before a fixed point is reached.
comment: It is not known whether the sequence is well-defined for all values. For example, does a(144) have a finite value? Cf. the sequence A260441, starting iteration from 1361 = A091209(144).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..143
program: A234742(n) = factorback(subst(lift(factor(Mod(1, 2)*Pol(binary(n)))), x, 2)); \\ After _M. F. Hasler_'s Feb 18 2014 code.
A260712(n) = {my(prev=-1,i=-1); until((n==prev), prev = n; n = A234742(n); i++); return(i); }
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 04 2015
